tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE transportation_routes (
  route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_name VARCHAR(255),
  start_location VARCHAR(255),
  end_location VARCHAR(255),
  distance_km FLOAT,
  transport_mode VARCHAR(50),
  schedule_time TIME,
  eco_friendly BOOLEAN
)

CREATE TABLE Routes (route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
route_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
distance FLOAT NOT NULL,
start_location VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
end_location VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);

CREATE TABLE Schedules (schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
route_id INT NOT NULL,
departure_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
arrival_time TIMESTAMP NOT NULL,
FOREIGN KEY (route_id) REFERENCES Routes(route_id));
CREATE TABLE routes (route_id INT PRIMARY KEY, origin_city VARCHAR(50), destination_city VARCHAR(50), distance FLOAT);
CREATE TABLE schedules (schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY, route_id INT, departure_time TIMESTAMP, arrival_time TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE logistics_companies (company_id INT PRIMARY KEY, company_name VARCHAR(50), is_ecofriendly BOOLEAN);

CREATE TABLE assignments (
  assignment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  schedule_id INT REFERENCES schedules(schedule_id),
  vehicle_id INT REFERENCES vehicles(vehicle_id),
  assigned_quantity INT,
  actual_quantity INT
);

CREATE TABLE Routes (
  route_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  origin VARCHAR(100),
  destination VARCHAR(100),
  distance FLOAT,
  transit_time INT
);

CREATE TABLE Schedules (
  schedule_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  route_id INT,
  vehicle_id INT,
  departure_time TIMESTAMP,
  arrival_time TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE Orders (
  order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  route_id INT,
  vehicle_id INT,
  order_date DATE,
  delivery_status VARCHAR(50)
);
